body_html:
This is not a bug. You've made a mistake. In fact, your example will produce an exception:

tmp = tf.constant(-1, shape=[64, 20])
t = tf.split(tmp, [15], 1)

ValueError: Sum of output sizes must match the size of the original Tensor along the split dimension or the sum of the positive sizes must be less if it contains a -1 for 'split' (op: 'SplitV') with input shapes: [64,20], [1], [] and with computed input tensors: input[1] = <15>, input[2] = <1>.
body_text:
This is not a bug. You've made a mistake. In fact, your example will produce an exception:
tmp = tf.constant(-1, shape=[64, 20])
t = tf.split(tmp, [15], 1)

ValueError: Sum of output sizes must match the size of the original Tensor along the split dimension or the sum of the positive sizes must be less if it contains a -1 for 'split' (op: 'SplitV') with input shapes: [64,20], [1], [] and with computed input tensors: input[1] = <15>, input[2] = <1>.
body:
This is not a bug. You've made a mistake. In fact, your example will produce an exception:

```python
tmp = tf.constant(-1, shape=[64, 20])
t = tf.split(tmp, [15], 1)
```
>ValueError: Sum of output sizes must match the size of the original Tensor along the split dimension or the sum of the positive sizes must be less if it contains a -1 for 'split' (op: 'SplitV') with input shapes: [64,20], [1], [] and with computed input tensors: input[1] = <15>, input[2] = <1>.
